70   | /*++++
71   |  ** ** Function-Header ***************************************************** **
72   |  ** 									     **
73   |  **   Function:		Tcl_ArgvToObjv					     **
74   |  ** 									     **
75   |  **   Description:	Take a Unix NULL terminated vector of char strings   **
76   |  **			and create a Tcl_Obj vector.			     **
77   |  **			If argc < 0 then count the elements		     **
78   |  ** 									     **
79   |  **   First Edition:	2009/08/23					     **
80   |  ** 									     **
81   |  **   Parameters:	int		*objc		objv element count   **
82   |  **			Tcl_Obj 	**objv[]	objv vector	     **
83   |  **			int		argc		argv element count   **
84   |  **			const char	*argv[]		argv vector	     **
85   |  ** 									     **
86   |  **   Result:		int	TCL_OK		Successful completion	     **
87   |  ** 									     **
88   |  **   Attached Globals:	-						     **
89   |  ** 									     **
90   |  ** ************************************************************************ **
91   |  ++++*/
92   | 
93   | int Tcl_ArgvToObjv(
94   | 	int *objc,
95   | 	Tcl_Obj *** objv,
96   | 	int argc,
97   | 	char * const *argv
98   | ) {
99   | 	char * const *aptr = argv;
100  | 	Tcl_Obj       **optr;
101  | 
102  | 	/** if argc < 0 then count the number of elements **/
103  | 	if (argc < 0) {
104  | 		argc = 0;
105  | 		while (aptr && *aptr) {
106  | 			aptr++;
107  | 			argc++;
108  | 		}
109  | 	}
110  | 
111  | 	*objc = argc;
112  | 
113  | 	/** allocate the necessary memory **/
114  | 	if (!(optr = *objv =
115  | 	     (Tcl_Obj **) module_malloc((argc + 1) * sizeof(Tcl_Obj *))))
116  | 		if (OK != ErrorLogger(ERR_ALLOC, LOC, NULL))
117  | 			return (TCL_ERROR);   /** ----- EXIT (FAILURE) ----> **/
118  | 
119  | 	/** create the list of TCL objects **/
120  | 	while (argc--) {
121  | 		*optr = Tcl_NewStringObj(*argv++, -1);
122  | 		/* must increment the reference count */
123  | 		Tcl_IncrRefCount(*optr++);
124  | 	}
125  | 	*optr = (Tcl_Obj *) NULL;
126  | 
127  | 	return (TCL_OK);		      /** ----- EXIT (SUCCESS) ----> **/
128  | 
129  | } /** End of 'Tcl_ArgvToObjv' **/
130  | 
131  | /*++++
132  |  ** ** Function-Header ***************************************************** **
133  |  ** 									     **
134  |  **   Function:		Tcl_ObjvToArgv					     **
135  |  ** 									     **
136  |  **   Description:	Take a Unix NULL terminated vector of char strings   **
137  |  **			and create a Tcl_Obj vector.			     **
138  |  ** 									     **
139  |  **   First Edition:	2009/08/23					     **
140  |  ** 									     **
141  |  **   Parameters:	int		*argc		argv element count   **
142  |  **			const char	**argv[]	argv vector	     **
143  |  **			int		objc		objv element count   **
144  |  **			Tcl_Obj 	*objv[]		objv vector	     **
145  |  ** 									     **
146  |  **   Result:		int	TCL_OK		Successful completion	     **
147  |  ** 									     **
148  |  **   Attached Globals:	-						     **
149  |  ** 									     **
150  |  ** ************************************************************************ **
151  |  ++++*/
152  | 
153  | int Tcl_ObjvToArgv(
154  | 	int *argc,
155  | 	char ***argv,
156  | 	int objc,
157  | 	Tcl_Obj * CONST84 * objv
158  | ) {
159  | 	Tcl_Obj * CONST84 * optr = objv;
160  | 	char    	**aptr;
161  | 
162  | 	/** if objc < 0 then count the number of elements **/
163  | 	if (objc < 0) {
164  | 		objc = 0;
165  | 		while (optr && *optr) {
166  | 			optr++;
167  | 			objc++;
168  | 		}
169  | 	}
170  | 
171  | 	*argc = objc;
172  | 
173  | 	/** allocate the necessary memory **/
174  | 	if (!(aptr = *argv =
175  | 	     (char **) module_malloc((objc + 1) * sizeof(char *))))
176  | 		if (OK != ErrorLogger(ERR_ALLOC, LOC, NULL))
177  | 			return (TCL_ERROR);   /** ----- EXIT (FAILURE) ----> **/
178  | 
179  | 	/** create the list of strings **/
180  | 	while (objc--) {
181  | 		*aptr++ = stringer(NULL,0, Tcl_GetString(*optr++), NULL);
182  | 	}
183  | 	*aptr = (char *) NULL;
184  | 
185  | 	return (TCL_OK);		      /** ----- EXIT (SUCCESS) ----> **/
186  | 
187  | } /** End of 'Tcl_ObjvToArgv' **/
188  | 
189  | /*++++
190  |  ** ** Function-Header ***************************************************** **
191  |  ** 									     **
192  |  **   Function:		mhash_*						     **
193  |  ** 									     **
194  |  **   Description:	A collection of functions for managing a hash	     **
195  |  **			array of objects with the explicit assumption	     **
196  |  **			that the keys are strings.			     **
197  |  ** 									     **
198  |  **   First Edition:	2009/08/28					     **
199  |  ** 									     **
200  |  **   Parameters:	MHashType	  type		of hash contents     **
201  |  **			MHash		 *mh		MHash object ptr     **
202  |  **			MHash		**mhp		MHash object address **
203  |  **			char		*key		hash element key     **
204  |  ** 									     **
205  |  **   Exports:								     **
206  |  **	mhash_ctor		constructs MHash object			     **
207  |  **	mhash_dtor		destructs  Mhash object			     **
208  |  **	mhash_copy		constructs a copy of a Mhash object	     **
209  |  **	mhash_add		add    a key/value pair			     **
210  |  **	mhash_del		delete a key/value pair			     **
211  |  **	mhash_type		type of MHash				     **
212  |  **	mhash_number		number of key/value pairs		     **
213  |  **	mhash_keys_uvec		return uvec object of keys		     **
214  |  **	mhash_keys		return vector of keys			     **
215  |  **	mhash_value		return value for given key		     **
216  |  ** 									     **
217  |  **   Result:		int	TCL_OK		Successful completion	     **
218  |  ** 									     **
219  |  **   Attached Globals:	-						     **
220  |  ** 									     **
221  |  ** ************************************************************************ **
222  |  ++++*/
223  | 
224  | /* MHash data allocation functions for the various types
225  |  * internal use only
226  |  */
227  | /* type: MHashInt */
228  | 
229  | static int	mhash_int_add(void	**data, va_list ap) {
230  | 	intptr_t num = va_arg(ap,intptr_t);
231  | 	if (!data) return -1;		/* NULL ptr */
232  | 	if ((char *) *data) return 1;		/* already allocated */
233  | 	*data = (void *) num;
234  | 	return 0;
235  | }
236  | 
237  | static int	mhash_int_del(void	**data, va_list ap) {
238  | 	*data = (void *) NULL;
239  | 	return 0;
240  | }
241  | 
242  | /* type: MHashStrings */
243  | 
244  | static int	mhash_strings_add(void	**data, va_list ap) {
245  | 	char const *str = va_arg(ap,char *);
246  | 	if (!data) return -1;		/* NULL ptr */
247  | 	if ((char *) *data) return 1;		/* already allocated */
248  | 	if ((*data = (void *) stringer(NULL,0, str, NULL)))
249  | 		return 0;
250  | 	return -2;
251  | }
252  | 
253  | static int	mhash_strings_del(void	**data, va_list ap) {
254  | 	null_free(data);
255  | 	return 0;
256  | }
257  | 
258  | /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
259  | /* mhash_ctor: MHash constructor function
260  |  */
261  | MHash *mhash_ctor(MHashType type) {
262  | 	MHash *mhp = (MHash *) NULL;
263  | 
264  | 	/* allocate the hash structure */
265  | 	if (!(mhp = (MHash *) module_malloc(sizeof(MHash))))
266  | 		if (OK != ErrorLogger(ERR_ALLOC, LOC, NULL))
267  | 			return (MHash *) NULL; 	/** ---- EXIT (FAILURE) ---> **/
268  | 
269  | 	/* set some struct elements */
270  | 	mhp->type = type;
271  | 	if (!(mhp->hash =(Tcl_HashTable *)module_malloc(sizeof(Tcl_HashTable))))
272  | 		if (OK != ErrorLogger(ERR_ALLOC, LOC, NULL))
273  | 			return (MHash *) NULL; 	/** ---- EXIT (FAILURE) ---> **/
274  | 	Tcl_InitHashTable(mhp->hash,TCL_STRING_KEYS);
275  | 
276  | 	if (!(mhp->keys = uvec_ctor(5)))
277  | 		if (OK != ErrorLogger(ERR_UVEC, LOC, NULL))
278  | 			return (MHash *) NULL; 	/** ---- EXIT (FAILURE) ---> **/
279  | 
280  | 	/* set the data add/del fns */
281  | 	switch (type) {
282  | 	case MHashStrings:
283  | 		mhp->add = mhash_strings_add;
284  | 		mhp->del = mhash_strings_del;
285  | 		break;
286  | 	case MHashInt:
287  | 		mhp->add = mhash_int_add;
288  | 		mhp->del = mhash_int_del;
289  | 		break;
290  | 	default:
291  | 		if (OK != ErrorLogger(ERR_MHASH, LOC, NULL))
292  | 			return (MHash *) NULL; 	/** ---- EXIT (FAILURE) ---> **/
293  | 	}
294  | 
295  | 	return mhp;
296  | }
297  | 
298  | /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
299  | /* mhash_dtor: MHash destructor function
300  |  */
301  | int mhash_dtor(MHash **mhp) {
302  | 	MHash *mh = *mhp;
303  | 	char **kvec;
304  | 
305  | 	if (!mhp || !mh)		/* nothing to do */
306  | 		return TCL_OK;
307  | 
308  | 	/* remove data elements */
309  | 	kvec = uvec_vector(mh->keys);
310  | 	while (kvec && *kvec) {
311  | 		if (TCL_OK != mhash_del_(mh,*kvec))
312  | 			if (OK != ErrorLogger(ERR_MHASH, LOC, NULL))
313  | 				return TCL_ERROR;/** --- EXIT (FAILURE) ---> **/
314  | 		kvec++;
315  | 	}
316  | 	/* dealloc struct elements */
317  | 	if (uvec_dtor(&(mh->keys)))
318  | 		if (OK != ErrorLogger(ERR_UVEC, LOC, NULL))
319  | 			return TCL_ERROR; 	/** ---- EXIT (FAILURE) ---> **/
320  | 
321  | 	Tcl_DeleteHashTable(mh->hash);
322  | 	null_free((void *) &(mh->hash));
323  | 
324  | 	/* dealloc struct */
325  | 	null_free((void *) mhp);
326  | 
327  | 	return TCL_OK;
328  | }
329  | 
330  | /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
331  | /* mhash_copy: MHash copy constructor function
332  |  */
333  | MHash *mhash_copy(MHash *mh) {
334  | 	MHash *mhc = (MHash *) NULL;
335  | 	char **keys = mhash_keys(mh);
336  | 
337  | 	/* construct a new MHash object */
338  | 	if (!(mhc = mhash_ctor(mh->type)))
339  | 		goto unwind0;
340  | 
341  | 	while (keys && *keys) {
342  | 		if (TCL_OK != mhash_add(mhc, *keys, mhash_value(mh, *keys)))
343  | 			goto unwind1;
344  | 		keys++;
345  | 	}
346  | 
347  | 	return mhc;
348  | 
349  | unwind1:
350  | 	mhash_dtor(&mhc);
351  | unwind0:
352  | 	return (MHash *) NULL;
353  | }
354  | 
355  | /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
356  | /* mhash_del_ - delete only the data element */
357  | int mhash_del_(MHash *mh, const char *key, ...) {
358  | 	va_list vargs;
359  | 	Tcl_HashEntry *hep = (Tcl_HashEntry *) NULL;
360  | 	void *tmp = (void *) NULL;
361  | 
362  | 	if (!mh && !*key)
363  | 		if (OK != ErrorLogger(ERR_MHASH, LOC, NULL))
364  | 			return TCL_ERROR; 	/** ---- EXIT (FAILURE) ---> **/
365  | 
366  | 	/* get variable arg pointer */
367  | 	va_start(vargs, key);
368  | 
369  | 	/* find and delete element */
370  | 	if ((hep = Tcl_FindHashEntry(mh->hash, (char *) key))) {
371  | 		tmp = (void *) Tcl_GetHashValue(hep);
372  | 		if (tmp)
373  | 			(mh->del)(&tmp, vargs);
374  | 		Tcl_DeleteHashEntry(hep);
375  | 	}
376  | 
377  | 	return TCL_OK;
378  | }
379  | 
380  | /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
381  | /* mhash_del - delete data element and vector element */
382  | int mhash_del(MHash *mh, const char *key, ...) {
383  | 	va_list vargs;
384  | 	int	in;
385  | 
386  | 	/* get variable arg pointer */
387  | 	va_start(vargs, key);
388  | 
389  | 	if ((in = uvec_find(mh->keys, key, UVEC_ASCEND)) < -1)
390  | 		if (OK != ErrorLogger(ERR_UVEC, LOC, NULL))
391  | 			return TCL_ERROR; 	/** ---- EXIT (FAILURE) ---> **/
392  | 	if (in == -1)	/* not found */
393  | 			return TCL_OK;
394  | 
395  | 	if ((in = uvec_delete(mh->keys, in)) < 0)
396  | 		if (OK != ErrorLogger(ERR_UVEC, LOC, NULL))
397  | 			return TCL_ERROR; 	/** ---- EXIT (FAILURE) ---> **/
398  | 
399  | 	return mhash_del_(mh, key);
400  | }
401  | 
402  | /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
403  | /* mhash_add - add data element */
404  | int mhash_add(MHash *mh, const char *key, ...) {
405  | 	va_list vargs;
406  | 	Tcl_HashEntry *hep = (Tcl_HashEntry *) NULL;
407  | 	void *tmp = (void *) NULL;
408  | 	int new;
409  | 
410  | 	/* see if exists already - don't add to vector */
411  | 	if (uvec_find(mh->keys, key, UVEC_ASCEND) < 0) {
412  | 		if (uvec_add(mh->keys, key) < 0)
413  | 			if (OK != ErrorLogger(ERR_UVEC, LOC, NULL))
414  | 				return TCL_ERROR;/** --- EXIT (FAILURE) ---> **/
415  | 	}
416  | 
417  | 	/* get variable arg pointer */
418  | 	va_start(vargs, key);
419  | 
420  | 	/* change current element */
421  | 	hep = Tcl_CreateHashEntry(mh->hash, key, &new);
422  | 	if (!new) {
423  | 		tmp = (void *) Tcl_GetHashValue(hep);
424  | 		if (tmp)
425  | 			(mh->del)(&tmp, vargs);
426  | 	}
427  | 
428  | 	/* add element */
429  | 	if ((mh->add)(&tmp, vargs) < 0)
430  | 		if (OK != ErrorLogger(ERR_MHASH, LOC, NULL))
431  | 			return TCL_ERROR;/** --- EXIT (FAILURE) ---> **/
432  | 	Tcl_SetHashValue(hep, (char *) tmp);
433  | 
434  | 	return TCL_OK;
435  | }
436  | 
437  | /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
438  | /*
439  |  * accessor methods
440  |  */
441  | /* mhash_type - return the type of MHash this is */
442  | MHashType mhash_type(MHash *mh) {
443  | 	return mh->type;
444  | }
445  | 
446  | /* mhash_number - return the number of key/value pairs */
447  | int mhash_number(MHash *mh) {
448  | 	return uvec_number(mh->keys);
449  | }
450  | 
451  | /* mhash_keys_uvec - return a pointer to internal uvec  */
452  | uvec *mhash_keys_uvec(MHash *mh) {
453  | 	return mh->keys;
454  | }
455  | 
456  | /* mhash_keys - return a pointer to internal uvec vector  */
457  | char **mhash_keys(MHash *mh) {
458  | 	return uvec_vector(mh->keys);
459  | }
460  | 
461  | void *mhash_value(MHash *mh, const char *key) {
462  | 	Tcl_HashEntry	*he;		/** result from Tcl hash search	     **/
463  | 	
464  | 	if(!(he = Tcl_FindHashEntry(mh->hash, key)))
465  | 		return (void *) NULL;
466  | 
467  | 	return Tcl_GetHashValue(he);
468  | }
